Detailed Description

Abstract base class for all editors.

Member Enumeration Documentation

anonymous enum
 

Enumerator:
ID 

Reimplemented from Control.

enum AbstractEditor::SelectionStyle
 

Defines the style of selected items. The default style can be configured inside the class OptionalConfig by adjusting the parameter OptionalConfigBase::SelectionStyle. The selection style can be changed dynamically for each instance by invoking AbstractEditor::SetSelectionStyle(). The look of the selection style can be customized by overwriting AbstractEditor::DrawSelection().

Enumerator:
InvertedSelection  The selected items are inverted by an XOR operation.
TransparentSelection  The selected items are transparent by using the color Color::SelectionBackground. As alpha blending is used, this style is more expensive from a performance point of view than AbstractEditor::InvertedSelection.

Member Function Documentation

void AbstractEditor::AssureValidCaretIndex (  INT &  index  )  [protected]
 

Assures that the index is corrected in a way that the caret is on a valid position (the maximum item count of the document and the edit mode is respected).

void AbstractEditor::AssureValidIndex (  INT &  index  )  const [protected]
 

Assures that the index is corrected in a way that it is has a valid position (the maximum item count of the document is respected).

BOOLEAN AbstractEditor::Backspace (   )  [virtual]
 

Deletes the item left of the caret. If the caret is on the first item, no item is deleted.

Reimplemented in MultiMediaEditor, AbstractLineEditor, AbstractMultiLineEditor, PasswordEditor, EmsEditor, and SmsEditor.

See also:
Control::Cleanup

Reimplemented from Control.

Reimplemented in MultiMediaEditor.

void AbstractEditor::DrawSelection (  DeviceContext *  dc,
const Rect &  bounds
)  const [virtual]
 

Draws a selection above the area marked as bounds. The default implementation respects the styles AbstractEditor::InvertedSelection and AbstractEditor::TransparentSelection. Usually this method is invoked by the view object of editors and it should not be necessary for applications to invoke this method directly.

virtual INT AbstractEditor::GetCaretIndex (   )  const [pure virtual]
 

Returns:
Index of item where caret is positioned. -1 is returned, if caret is on an invalid position.

virtual Rect AbstractEditor::GetItemRect (  INT  index  )  const [pure virtual]
 

Returns the bounding rectangle of the item with the specified index.

Parameters:
index Index of the item.
Returns:
Rectangle of the item given by the index. If the index is smaller than zero, an empty rectangle is returned.

Implemented in AbstractLineEditor, and AbstractMultiLineEditor.

INT AbstractEditor::GetMaxItemCount (   )  const
 

Returns:
Number of maximum items which can be inserted into the document. -1 is returned, if there is no specified limit.

void AbstractEditor::GetSelection (  INT *  item_index,
INT *  count
)  const
 

Returns the selection-range.

Parameters:
item_index Output-parameter, which indicates the index of the item where the selection starts.
count Output-parameter, which indicates the number of selected items. 0 means, that no selection has been done.

BOOLEAN AbstractEditor::InsertCompoundItem (  CompoundItem *  compound_item,
INT  comp_item_index = -1
) 
 

Wrapper-method for EditorDocument::InsertCompoundItem(). Additionally AbstractEditor::Update() is invoked to assure a consistent state of the editor with it's document.

See also:
EditorDocument::InsertCompoundItem()

Reimplemented in EmsEditor.

BOOLEAN AbstractEditor::InsertCompoundItemBeforeItem (  CompoundItem *  compound_item,
INT  item_index = -1
) 
 

Wrapper-method for EditorDocument::InsertCompoundItemBeforeItem(). Additionally AbstractEditor::Update() is invoked to assure a consistent state of the editor with it's document.

Parameters:
compound_item Pointer to the Compound-Item, which should be inserted.
item_index Index of the item, where the Compound-Item should be inserted. If the index is smaller zero, the item is inserted at the position of the caret.
Returns:
TRUE, if the inserting has been successful.
See also:
EditorDocument::InsertCompoundItemBeforeItem()

INT  index = -1
)  [virtual]
 

Inserts an item on the specified index.

Parameters:
item Item which should be inserted.
index Index of the item, where item should be inserted. If the index is smaller zero, the item is inserted at the position of the caret.

Reimplemented in MultiMediaEditor, AbstractLineEditor, AbstractMultiLineEditor, PasswordEditor, EmsEditor, and SmsEditor.

BOOLEAN AbstractEditor::IsCaretAlwaysVisible (   )  const [inline]
 

Returns TRUE, if the caret is always visible, even the editor does not have the focus. Per default FALSE is returned.

BOOLEAN AbstractEditor::IsReadOnly (   )  const [inline]
 

Returns TRUE, if the editor is in the read-only mode, which means that the the content can't be changed by the user.

BOOLEAN AbstractEditor::IsStandaloneItem (  INT  index  )  const [virtual]
 

Tests if an item at the given index is rendered standalone or not. For text, it can be that the character is a diacritic that modifies preceding or following characters. Other items will always return TRUE.

Parameters:
index the index of the character to be tested
Returns:
TRUE if the item is a non-character, or if the character is rendered standalone, FALSE otherwise

Reimplemented in AbstractMultiLineEditor.

void AbstractEditor::MoveCaret (  INT  steps  )  [virtual]
 

Moves the caret a number of steps left or right. Scrolling and assigning of the right column of the caret is done by the editor. It is assured, that after invoking this method the caret is always fully visible and has a valid index.

Parameters:
steps If smaller than zero, the caret is moved left as often as specified. If greater than zero, the caret is moved right as often as specified.

Reimplemented in AbstractLineEditor, AbstractMultiLineEditor, DateEditor, TimeEditor, and SearchBox.

BOOLEAN AbstractEditor::RemoveItem (  INT  index = -1  )  [virtual]
 

Deletes the item with the specified index.

Parameters:
index Index of the item which should be deleted. If the index is smaller than zero, the item beyound the caret is deleted.

Reimplemented in MultiMediaEditor, AbstractLineEditor, AbstractMultiLineEditor, PasswordEditor, EmsEditor, and SmsEditor.

INT  index = -1
)  [virtual]
 

Replaces the item on the specified index.

Parameters:
item Item which should replace another item.
index Index of the item, which should be replaced. If the index is smaller zero, the item beyound the caret is replaced.

Reimplemented in MultiMediaEditor, AbstractLineEditor, AbstractMultiLineEditor, PasswordEditor, and EmsEditor.

void AbstractEditor::SetCaretAlwaysVisible (  BOOLEAN  visible  ) 
 

If visible is TRUE, the caret is always visible, even the editor does not have the focus. This might be useful, when having e. g. a virtual keyboard-control, which delegates its input to the editor. Per default the caret is not visible, when the editor loses the focus.

void AbstractEditor::SetCaretIndex (  INT  index  ) 
 

Wrapper method for setting the caret to the item with the index index by invoking MoveCaret(-GetCaretIndex() + index).

void AbstractEditor::SetEditMode (  Caret::Mode  mode  ) 
 

Parameters:
mode Mode of the editor: Caret::Insert means that a new item is inserted before the item beyound the caret, Caret::Overwrite means that a new item replaces the item beyound the caret.

void AbstractEditor::SetInputMapper (  INT  input_mapper_id  ) 
 

Sets the input-mapper of the editor to the input-mapper given by input_mapper_id. The mapping from the input-mapper-id to the input-mapper-class is done by the class EditConfig (see Config/EditConfig).

BOOLEAN AbstractEditor::SetProperty (  ResourceParser &  parser,
const GuiObjectFactory::PropertyId  prop_id
) 
 

Initializes the instance by reading out a resource file generated by ARAGON. This method may not be invoked by the MMI in a direct manner and might be changed in future releases.

Reimplemented from Control.

Reimplemented in MultiMediaEditor, AbstractLineEditor, AbstractMultiLineEditor, DateEditor, IpAddrEditor, LineEditor, MultiLineEditor, PasswordEditor, and TimeEditor.

void AbstractEditor::SetReadOnly (  BOOLEAN  read_only  )  [virtual]
 

Parameters:
read_only TRUE means that the content can't be changed by the user.

Reimplemented in MultiMediaEditor, and MultiLineEditor.

void AbstractEditor::SetSelection (  INT  item_index,
INT  count
) 
 

Sets a selection from the item with the index item_index for count items.

void AbstractEditor::SetSelectionStyle (  SelectionStyle  style  ) 
 

Sets the style for selected items (see AbstractEditor::SelectionStyle). The default style can be configured inside the class OptionalConfig by adjusting the parameter OptionalConfigBase::SelectionStyle.

void AbstractEditor::StartSelection (   ) 
 

Starts the selection on the item specified by the caret. The selection is automatically modified when moving the caret, until StopSelection has been invoked.

See also:
GetSelection

void AbstractEditor::StopSelection (   ) 
 

Stops the selection, which has been started by StartSelection.

See also:
StartSelection

void AbstractEditor::Update (   )  [virtual]
 

Updates the internal data of the editor and leads to a redraw. Use this method only when changing the content of the document or its compound-items directly by e. g. the input-mapper to inform the editor about the change. Changing the document or its compound-items directly may allow better performance for operations on a large number of items in one time.

Reimplemented in MultiMediaEditor, AbstractLineEditor, and AbstractMultiLineEditor.

void AbstractEditor::UpdateDocumentAlphabet (  InputMapper::Alphabet  alphabet  ) 
 

Updates the alphabet used by the document. Invoking this method is useful when an input mapper changes the used alphabet coding from e. g. seven bit to UCS2.
